     \<Phi> C M ! pc = \<tau>; pc < size ins \<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> OK \<tau> \<in> states P mxs (1+size Ts+mxl)"

theorem no_type_error:
  fixes \<sigma> :: jvm_state
  assumes welltyped: "wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P" and conforms: "P,\<Phi> \<turnstile> \<sigma> \<surd>"
  shows "exec_d P \<sigma> \<noteq> TypeError"

theorem welltyped_aggressive_imp_defensive:
  "wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P \<Longrightarrow> P,\<Phi> \<turnstile> \<sigma> \<surd> \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'
  \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> (Normal \<sigma>) -jvmd\<rightarrow> (Normal \<sigma>')"

lemma not_TypeError_eq [iff]:
  "x \<noteq> TypeError = (\<exists>t. x = Normal t)"

text \<open>
  Some simple lemmas about the type testing functions of the
  defensive JVM:
\<close>
lemma typeof_NoneD [simp,dest]: "typeof v = Some x \<Longrightarrow> \<not>is_Addr v"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. typeof v = \<lfloor>x\<rfloor> \<Longrightarrow> \<not> is_Addr v
by (cases v) auto

lemma is_Ref_def2:
  "is_Ref v = (v = Null \<or> (\<exists>a. v = Addr a))"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. is_Ref v = (v = Null \<or> (\<exists>a. v = Addr a))
by (cases v) (auto simp add: is_Ref_def)
lemma [iff]: "is_Ref Null"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. is_Ref Null
by (simp add: is_Ref_def2)
lemma is_RefI [intro, simp]: "P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T \<Longrightarrow> is_refT T \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v
apply (cases T)

proof (prove)
goal (5 subgoals):
 1. \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T; T = Void\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v
 2. \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T; T = Boolean\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v
 3. \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T; T = Integer\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v
 4. \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T; T = NT\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v
 5. \<And>x5.
       \<lbrakk>P,h \<turnstile> v :\<le> T; is_refT T;
        T = Class x5\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> is_Ref v
apply (auto simp add: is_refT_def is_Ref_def dest: conf_ClassD)

proof (prove)
goal:
No subgoals!
done

lemma wt_jvm_prog_states:
  "\<lbrakk> wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P; P \<turnstile> C sees M: Ts\<rightarrow>T = (mxs, mxl, ins, et) in C; 
     \<Phi> C M ! pc = \<tau>; pc < size ins \<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> OK \<tau> \<in> states P mxs (1+size Ts+mxl)"
apply (unfold wf_jvm_prog_phi_def)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>wf_prog
              (\<lambda>P C (M, Ts, T\<^sub>r, mxs, mxl\<^sub>0, is, xt).
                  wt_method P C Ts T\<^sub>r mxs mxl\<^sub>0 is xt
                   (\<Phi> C M))
              P;
     P \<turnstile> C sees M: Ts\<rightarrow>T = (mxs, mxl, ins, et) in C;
     \<Phi> C M ! pc = \<tau>; pc < length ins\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> OK \<tau> \<in> states P mxs (1 + length Ts + mxl)
apply (drule (1) sees_wf_mdecl)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P \<turnstile> C sees M: Ts\<rightarrow>T = (mxs, mxl, ins,
                    et) in C;
     \<Phi> C M ! pc = \<tau>; pc < length ins;
     wf_mdecl
      (\<lambda>P C (M, Ts, T\<^sub>r, mxs, mxl\<^sub>0, is, xt).
          wt_method P C Ts T\<^sub>r mxs mxl\<^sub>0 is xt (\<Phi> C M))
      P C (M, Ts, T, mxs, mxl, ins, et)\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> OK \<tau> \<in> states P mxs (1 + length Ts + mxl)
apply (simp add: wf_mdecl_def wt_method_def check_types_def)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P \<turnstile> C sees M: Ts\<rightarrow>T = (mxs, mxl, ins,
                    et) in C;
     \<Phi> C M ! pc = \<tau>; pc < length ins;
     (\<forall>x\<in>set Ts. is_type P x) \<and>
     is_type P T \<and>
     ins \<noteq> [] \<and>
     length (\<Phi> C M) = length ins \<and>
     OK ` set (\<Phi> C M)
     \<subseteq> states P mxs (Suc (length Ts + mxl)) \<and>
     wt_start P C Ts mxl (\<Phi> C M) \<and>
     (\<forall>pc<length ins.
         P,T,mxs,length
                  ins,et \<turnstile> ins ! pc,pc :: \<Phi> C M)\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> OK \<tau> \<in> states P mxs (Suc (length Ts + mxl))
apply (blast intro: nth_in)

proof (prove)
goal:
No subgoals!
done

text \<open>
  The theorem above tells us that, in welltyped programs, the
  defensive machine reaches the same result as the aggressive
  one (after arbitrarily many steps).
\<close>

theorem welltyped_aggressive_imp_defensive:
  "wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P \<Longrightarrow> P,\<Phi> \<turnstile> \<sigma> \<surd> \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'
  \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> (Normal \<sigma>) -jvmd\<rightarrow> (Normal \<sigma>')"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P; P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok];
     P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> Normal
\<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>'

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P; P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok];
     P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> Normal
\<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>'
apply (simp only: exec_all_def)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P; P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok];
     (\<sigma>, \<sigma>')
     \<in> {(\<sigma>, \<sigma>').
            exec (P, \<sigma>) =
            \<lfloor>\<sigma>'\<rfloor>}\<^sup>*\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> Normal
\<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>'
apply (erule rtrancl_induct)

proof (prove)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<lbrakk>wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P;
     P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok]\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> Normal
\<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>
 2. \<And>y z.
       \<lbrakk>wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P;
        P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok];
        (\<sigma>, y)
        \<in> {(\<sigma>, \<sigma>').
               exec (P, \<sigma>) = \<lfloor>\<sigma>'\<rfloor>}\<^sup>*;
        (y, z)
        \<in> {(\<sigma>, \<sigma>').
               exec (P, \<sigma>) = \<lfloor>\<sigma>'\<rfloor>};
        P \<turnstile> Normal \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal y\<rbrakk>

   \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal z
apply (simp add: exec_all_d_def1)

       \<lbrakk>wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P;
        P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok];

        \<in> {(\<sigma>, \<sigma>').

        (y, z)
        \<in> {(\<sigma>, \<sigma>').
               exec (P, \<sigma>) = \<lfloor>\<sigma>'\<rfloor>};
        P \<turnstile> Normal \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal y\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> P \<turnstile> Normal
   \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal z
apply simp
apply (simp only: exec_all_def [symmetric])
apply (frule BV_correct, assumption+)
apply (drule no_type_error, assumption, drule no_type_error_commutes, simp)

text \<open>
  As corollary we get that the aggressive and the defensive machine
  are equivalent for welltyped programs (if started in a conformant
  state or in the canonical start state)
\<close>

corollary welltyped_commutes:
  fixes \<sigma> :: jvm_state
  assumes wf: "wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P" and conforms: "P,\<Phi> \<turnstile> \<sigma> \<surd>" 
  shows "P \<turnstile> (Normal \<sigma>) -jvmd\<rightarrow> (Normal \<sigma>') = P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<turnstile> Normal \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>' =
    P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'
apply rule

proof (prove)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. P \<turnstile> Normal
                    \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal
           \<sigma>' \<Longrightarrow>
    P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>'
 2. P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>' \<Longrightarrow>
    P \<turnstile> Normal \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>'
apply (erule defensive_imp_aggressive)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> \<sigma>' \<Longrightarrow>
    P \<turnstile> Normal \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> Normal \<sigma>'
apply (erule welltyped_aggressive_imp_defensive [OF wf conforms])

proof (prove)
goal:
No subgoals!
done

lemma not_TypeError_eq [iff]:
  "x \<noteq> TypeError = (\<exists>t. x = Normal t)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (x \<noteq> TypeError) = (\<exists>t. x = Normal t)
by (cases x) auto

locale cnf =
  fixes P and \<Phi> and \<sigma>
  assumes wf: "wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P"  
  assumes cnf: "correct_state P \<Phi> \<sigma>"

theorem (in cnf) no_type_errors:
  "P \<turnstile> (Normal \<sigma>) -jvmd\<rightarrow> \<sigma>' \<Longrightarrow> \<sigma>' \<noteq> TypeError"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<turnstile> Normal
                    \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> \<sigma>' \<Longrightarrow>
    \<sigma>' \<noteq> TypeError
apply (unfold exec_all_d_def1)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (Normal \<sigma>, \<sigma>')
    \<in> (exec_1_d P)\<^sup>* \<Longrightarrow>
    \<sigma>' \<noteq> TypeError
apply (erule rtrancl_induct)

proof (prove)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Normal \<sigma> \<noteq> TypeError
 2. \<And>y z.
       \<lbrakk>(Normal \<sigma>, y) \<in> (exec_1_d P)\<^sup>*;
        P \<turnstile> y -jvmd\<rightarrow>\<^sub>1 z;
        y \<noteq> TypeError\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> z \<noteq> TypeError
apply simp

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>y z.
       \<lbrakk>(Normal \<sigma>, y) \<in> (exec_1_d P)\<^sup>*;
        P \<turnstile> y -jvmd\<rightarrow>\<^sub>1 z;
        y \<noteq> TypeError\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> z \<noteq> TypeError
apply (fold exec_all_d_def1)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>y z.
       \<lbrakk>P \<turnstile> Normal \<sigma> -jvmd\<rightarrow> y;
        P \<turnstile> y -jvmd\<rightarrow>\<^sub>1 z;
        y \<noteq> TypeError\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> z \<noteq> TypeError
apply (insert cnf wf)
apply clarsimp
apply (drule defensive_imp_aggressive)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z a aa b.
       \<lbrakk>P \<turnstile> Normal
                                (a, aa, b) -jvmd\<rightarrow>\<^sub>1 z;
        P,\<Phi> |- \<sigma> [ok]; wf_jvm_prog\<^bsub>\<Phi>\<^esub> P;
        P \<turnstile> \<sigma> -jvm\<rightarrow> (a, aa, b)\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>a aa b. z = Normal (a, aa, b)
apply (frule (2) BV_correct)
apply (drule (1) no_type_error)
back
apply (auto simp add: exec_1_d_eq)

proof (prove)
goal:
No subgoals!
done
